de.mrapp.android.adapter

Class SelectableListDecorator<DataType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator.AbstractDecorator
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator.AbstractListDecorator<DataType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.SelectableListDecorator<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullObjectDecorator

    public abstract class SelectableListDecorator<DataType>
extends AbstractListDecorator<DataType>
    An abstract base class for all decorators, which should allow to customize the appearance of the view, which is used to visualize the items of a SelectableListAdapter.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SelectableListDecorator()

      The method, which is invoked by an adapter to apply the decorator.
      abstract void onShowItem(android.content.Context context, SelectableListAdapter<DataType> adapter, android.view.View view, DataType item, int viewType, int index, boolean enabled, int state, boolean filtered, boolean selected)
      The method which is invoked, when the view, which is used to visualize an item, should be shown, respectively when it should be refreshed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelectableListDecorator

        public SelectableListDecorator()

    • Method Detail

      • applyDecorator

        public final void applyDecorator(@NonNull
                                 android.content.Context context,
                                 @NonNull
                                 SelectableListAdapter<DataType> adapter,
                                 android.view.View view,
                                 @NonNull
                                 DataType item,
                                 int index,
                                 boolean enabled,
                                 int state,
                                 boolean filtered,
                                 boolean selected)
        The method, which is invoked by an adapter to apply the decorator. It initializes the view holder pattern, which is provided by the decorator and then delegates the method call to the decorator's custom implementation of the method onShowItem(...):void.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        adapter - The adapter, whose items are visualized by the decorator, as an instance of the type SelectableListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        view - The view, which is used to visualize the item, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        item - The item, which should be visualized, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        index - The index of the item, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        enabled - True, if the item, which should be visualized, is currently enabled, false otherwise
        state - The current state of the item, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        filtered - True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter, false otherwise
        selected - True, if the item, which should be visualized, is currently selected, false otherwise

      • onShowItem

        public abstract void onShowItem(@NonNull
                                android.content.Context context,
                                @NonNull
                                SelectableListAdapter<DataType> adapter,
                                @NonNull
                                android.view.View view,
                                @NonNull
                                DataType item,
                                int viewType,
                                int index,
                                boolean enabled,
                                int state,
                                boolean filtered,
                                boolean selected)
        The method which is invoked, when the view, which is used to visualize an item, should be shown, respectively when it should be refreshed. The purpose of this method is to customize the appearance of the view, which is used to visualize the appropriate item, depending on its state and whether it is currently enabled or not.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        adapter - The adapter, whose items are visualized by the decorator, as an instance of the type SelectableListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        view - The view, which is used to visualize the item, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        item - The item, which should be visualized, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        viewType - The view type of the item, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        index - The index of the item, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        enabled - True, if the item, which should be visualized, is currently enabled, false otherwise
        state - The current state of the item, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        filtered - True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter, false otherwise
        selected - True, if the item, which should be visualized, is currently selected, false otherwise
